poems.title: Whispers of the Dawn
poems.author: Lily Grant
poems.text:
The morning whispers soft and low,
A gentle breeze begins to blow.
The sun peeks through the twilight mist,
As nature stirs, by light it's kissed.

poems.title: Autumn's Breath
poems.author: Evan Rhodes
poems.text:
Leaves that fall with colors bright,
Crimson, gold, and auburn light.
A fleeting moment, swift and brief,
The quiet sigh of autumn’s leaf.

poems.title: Moonlit Shores
poems.author: Celeste Rain
poems.text:
The ocean hums a lullaby,
Beneath the moon's watchful eye.
Waves that dance, so soft, so free,
A secret shared with you and me.

poems.title: Winter's Embrace
poems.author: David Snow
poems.text:
In winter’s cold, the world is still,
A frosty kiss on window sill.
But warmth resides in hearts that know,
The fire that lights in love's own glow.

poems.title: Beneath the Stars
poems.author: Mira Lowell
poems.text:
Beneath the stars we find our way,
In night’s embrace, we laugh, we play.
The sky a map of dreams untold,
A canvas filled with tales of old.

poems.title: A Summer Breeze
poems.author: Oliver Green
poems.text:
A summer breeze, so warm and kind,
It carries whispers on the wind.
Of days gone by and yet to come,
A song of joy that we hum.

poems.title: Echoes of the Past
poems.author: Sophia Rivers
poems.text:
In echoes of the past we tread,
Where memories and dreams are fed.
Each moment like a fleeting guest,
A heartbeat in an endless quest.

poems.title: The Quiet Path
poems.author: Jonas Hale
poems.text:
Through woods so still, a path does wind,
A quiet place for heart and mind.
Each step a pause, each breath a prayer,
The forest speaks in whispers rare.

poems.title: Rain's Soft Song
poems.author: Amara Stone
poems.text:
The rain taps lightly on the pane,
A soothing sound, a sweet refrain.
It sings of life and all things new,
Of tears that fall, of skies so blue.

poems.title: The Promise of Spring
poems.author: Eli Meadows
poems.text:
Buds that bloom in early spring,
A promise of what life will bring.
With every petal, soft and bright,
The world awakens to the light.
